channel.title: Not Making Sense
channel.description:
So, I tried getting help on this matter elsewhere, but was told that I fail at CSS, and freenode IRC is a useless piece of shit, so anyhow.
http://rifkwtf.com
See the "Home", .. well, below the other "Home"? It acts as if it was just like the other ones, but I'm not sure why.
Anyone care to look? Thanks.

item.title: Not Making Sense
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

i believe it has to do with that ur using a list

it thinks ur clicking on the UL list instead of the link thus its triggering the dropDown(id)

try a hide/unhiding div?

Read full topic

item.title: Not Making Sense
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

New question:
I don’t know much Javascript, so I stole a simple script from the nets.

I wanted to make a tree menu sorta thing, nomsain?
When I click on the children of the parent node, it thinks I’m clicking on the parent.
This makes it minimize the list when it shouldn’t.

The list item image doesn’t change either

<ul> <li><a href="#" id="index" onclick='fetchPage(id)'>Home</a></li> <li id="li1" onclick="dropDown(id);">Pictures <ul style="display: none;"> <li id="li2"><a href="#" onclick='fetchPicturePage("Group1", null)'>1</a></li> <li id="li3"><a href="#">2</a></li> </ul> </li> </ul>
That’s my HTML

And this is my JavaScript

function dropDown(id) { liItem = document.getElementById(id); target = liItem.childNodes[1]; if (target.style.display == "none") { target.style.display = "block"; target.style.listStyleImage = "url(util/tree/images/arrow_down.jpg)"; } else { target.style.display = "none"; target.style.listStyleImage = "url(util/tree/images/arrow.jpg)"; } }

See anything wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Not Making Sense
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

Oh, rather than setting your horizontal nav in seperate divs, set it in one. Wont take me 2 minutes.
[hr]
[php]

HomePicturesLinks
Home
errr 
<div id="footer">wut</div>[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Not Making Sense
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

The other ones are the horizontal navigation.
The vertical one is what I’m concerned about.

Read full topic
